title.rendered: Stepping Out of My Comfort Zone by Sofia, Colegio Gran Bretaña

content.rendered:
This year for the first time, I took part in the drama production for my school! I volunteered to perform a short monologue about a sousaphone player struggling to stay happy while stranded out at sea on a cruise ship. Even though I was asked to record my monologue at home rather than on the stage, it was still a real step out of my comfort zone.

    The experience of being in a school production is very fulfilling because it gives you that sense of being part of something great. All of your fellow actors and actresses work hard on their parts, as do you, so it feels really rewarding to work alongside them, even at a distance. Performing my part was also an adventure in itself; my character was absolutely fed up with living on a boat during the pandemic, which I was able to strongly relate to, so it made me even more passionate about performing my monologue with authenticity. I am usually not a person who would participate in anything involving drama or theatre because I never saw it as something that I would be good at or comfortable doing. Speaking in front of people isn’t usually that scary for me, but in this case, I was nervous about not doing my monologue justice or looking awkward or uncomfortable as a performer.

     However, by being in this year’s school production I realized that once you actually just take the step of signing yourself up and participating, it’s really not that difficult or scary at all! After practicing my monologue several times I actually really began to get into character and I enjoyed performing certain funny lines for the part. When the final version of the movie was released for the school, I felt really out of my comfort zone, but when I watched the film, I saw my section and I actually felt really proud and happy that I had participated. It was definitely a great, adventurous experience to be in the production and it has actually motivated me to participate again next year – hopefully, in a real-life theatre! For anyone wanting to step out of their comfort zone to experience something new, I would definitely recommend that you sign up for your school’s drama production. It may not seem like it now, but it is thrilling to be part of something like this and you will really feel that you have accomplished something extremely special!
